intro: Parosela terminalis, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged opposite along its stems. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Parosela terminalis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
